title:
Advances in Microscopy and Chemical
Microanatomy
description:
This module develops the foundations of microscopy and
chemical microanatomy essential for research and clinical
applications. It covers the visualization of biomolecules in
tissues and cells, including nuclei acids, proteins, lipids,
metabolites, inorganic materials and elements, in the fixed
and living state, and in the context of human microscopic
anatomy. Students will be introduced to different
microscopy techniques with emphasis on structure-function
relationships, and shown examples of how these can be
applied to solve problems in biomedical sciences. Suitable
clinical problems will be introduced throughout the course
to show the application of scientific knowledge, and to
integrate across disciplines.
faculty: Yong Loo Lin Sch of Medicine
